SEARCH
Module io.jstach.kiwi.kvs
Package io.jstach.kiwi.kvs

Interface KeyValuesResource

public sealed interface KeyValuesResource
Represents a resource that contains key-value pairs to be loaded and processed. A KeyValuesResource includes a URI, optional parameters, and metadata flags that determine its behavior during loading.

Resources can have special keys associated with them. The most important key is the load key (KEY_LOAD), which assigns a name to the resource. The resource name is the text following the load key prefix, and the value of the key should be a URI.

Other keys can be specified in two ways:

  1. As query parameters in the resource's URI (these keys will be removed before the resource is loaded).
  2. As additional key-value pairs within the same resource, using the resource name as part of the key (they keys will be removed from the final result).
The parameters are combined from both the URI and key value pairs but the key value pairs take prededence on collision. One advantage that URI query keys have is that they do not need the resource name as that can be deduced.
Resource Keys using default syntax
Constant Resource Key URI Query Key Description
KEY_LOAD _load_[resource] N/A Specifies a resource to load. The resource name is defined as the content following _load_. It should be alphanumeric with no spaces.
KEY_FLAGS _flags_[resource] _flags Defines flags associated with a resource. Replace [resource] with the actual resource name.
KEY_MEDIA_TYPE _mediaType_[resource] _mediaType Specifies the media type of a resource. Replace [resource] with the actual resource name.
KEY_PARAM _param_[resource]_[name] _param_[name] Defines parameters associated with a resource. Replace [resource] with the actual resource name, and [name] with the parameter name, which should be alphanumeric with no spaces.
KEY_FILTER _filter_[resource]_[filter] _filter_[filter] Specifies filters to apply to a resource. Replace [resource] with the actual resource name, and [filter] with the filter identifier, both of which should be alphanumeric with no spaces.
Resource loading flags
Flag Value Description
"NO_REQUIRE" Indicates that the resource is optional and no error should occur if it is not found. Synonym: "OPTIONAL"
"SENSITIVE" Marks the resource as containing sensitive key-value pairs, which should not be displayed or included in output such as toString.
"NO_ADD" Indicates that the key-value pairs from the resource should only be added to variables and not to the final resolved key-value set.
"NO_INTERPOLATE" Disables interpolation entirely for key-value pairs loaded from this resource.
Note: flags can be negated textual by appending NO_ or removing NO_ Example usage for building a KeyValuesResource: 
var resource = KeyValuesResource.builder("classpath:/config.properties")
	.name("config")
	.parameter("key1", "value1")
	.sensitive(true)
	.build();
See Also:
